results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of deco polyominoes of height n in which the maximal number of initial consecutive columns ending at the same level is k (1 <= k <= n).
comment: A deco polyomino is a directed column-convex polyomino in which the height, measured along the diagonal, is attained only in the last column.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 1..50 of the triangle, flattened
E. Barcucci, A. Del Lungo and R. Pinzani, "Deco" polyominoes, permutations and random generation, Theoretical Computer Science, 159, 1996, 29-42.
formula: T(n,k) = binomial(n-1, k-1) + Sum_{j=2..n-1} j!*(j-1)*binomial(n-1-j, k-1).
Sum of entries in row n is n! (A000142).
example: T(2,1)=1 (the vertical domino); T(2,2)=1 (the horizontal domino); T(3,1)=3 because we have (3), (1,2) and (2,1,1), where (a,b,c,...) stands for a polyomino with columns of lengths a,b,c,..., starting at level 0.
maple: T:=proc(n,k) options operator, arrow: binomial(n-1, k-1)+sum(factorial(j)*(j-1)*binomial(n-1-j, k-1),j=2..n-1) end proc: for n to 11 do seq(T(n, k),k=1..n) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = binomial(n-1, k-1) + sum(j=2, n-1, j!*(j-1)*binomial(n-1-j, k-1));
tabl(nn) = for (n=1, nn, for (k=1, n, print1(T(n,k), ", ")); print); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 16 2019
elif (k==1): return factorial(n) - sum(factorial(j) for j in (1..n-1))
else: return T(n-1, k-1) + T(n-1, k)
